note.p: Death: His house, 16 Elvaston Place, Queen's Gate, London (21 July 1897)

Career: Entered a printing office; Partner, Messrs Hine and Co, hosiery manufacturers, Nottingham; MP (radical) for Sheffield (1868-1885); MP for Brightside division, Shefffield (1885-1897); Privy Councillor (1880); introduced the Compulsory Education Act (1881); President of the Board of Trade (1886, 1892-1894); died of paralysis
Notes: Certificate of a Candidate of the privileged class for Election
